::Shadow Wing::

She transformed into bot mode and wrapped her arms around Lunarpine's 
neck. She felt his soft fur against her arms and face and she gently 
hugged him. She smiled and said in a soft voice," Your welcome. 
Anything for a good friend like you."  She was just happy to be with 
him, no matter what, she wanted to be with him. And she wasn't afraid 
to admit that to herself any more.
"I understand and what you said made sence.  I should be more careful 
in battle and not try to kill an entire army by myself. Besides, I 
got most of the moves from you anyway. Your a good teacher you know. 
Despite what you think, you've taught me a lot.  About myself and 
about you. Thank you for that."
She gave a gently squeeze around his thick wolf neck. She was just 
happy he was alive and thankful to the matrix that he wasn't mad at 
her.

"If you want, I can get another kill for you.  I figured since you 
saved my tail feathers a few times, I owed you dinner at least."


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> (Sorry I didn't get back sooner)
> 
> (Responding to all posts)
> Lunarpine looked up at Shadow Wing, "No thanks, I've already 
eaten," he says
> glancing behind a nearby rock where the remains of an antelope lay, 
it'd
> been a while since the kill, insects were already takeing care of 
the
> leftovers.
> 
> "I'm glad you found me." he rolled over exposing his vulnerable 
side."Take
> your best shot, I deserve it for how I treated you."
> 
> He paused waiting for her response.
> "I didn't mean that you couldn't fight at my side, I just meant 
that there
> were other bots needing your help more." He was trying to choose 
his words
> wisely to avoid sticking another paw in his mouth. "I'm a wolf, my 
sense of
> smells better than most bots sight. Even if I didn't have my 
scanners, multi
> vision sensors or any sight at all I'm still a better warrior than 
nearly
> anyone there.
> 
> He paused again, he didn't want her to know about his defect."You 
and Prowl
> put to much thought on me and put yourself at risk and look what 
happened,
> both of you went down protecting me when I could have moved better 
if I
> wasn't worrying about you. A unit needs to know the strengths and 
weaknesses
> of each member, without that their just getting in eachothers way. 
We won
> the fight, we were lucky."
> 
> "Oh I almost forgot, thanks for saving me.".
